page.title: 17FLORA IN EPPERSTONE
page.content: Most fields are bordered by{hedges which are mainly hawthorn but some contain other shrubs and trees and a total of 14 different varieties have been counted.Large{trees}of indigenous species grow in the hedges and gardens which also contain introduced species. The road into the village from the west is lined by a selection of large trees.All elms have been killed in recent years by Dutch Elm Disease but are suckering again.Because of intensive cultivation{wild flowers}are now only found in hedge bottoms, dumbles,woods,and unmanaged pasture but there are a large number of common species.Ramsons grow well in the dumbles,and rarer species such as coltsfoot,violets,primroses,toadflax, ladys smock,yellow iris,geranium,poppy ragged robin,wood sorrel and for-get- me-nots are found elsewhere.
